ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó ńne ḿbíte menò mie é lǎ cʉa éshwóŋo Yěsô, éshwóŋo yé páʼ Pilato la gÿo mé zẅéte pʉ̀a Ngalílîa, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ la ne ńnáa shúm pwɔʼ mbwó Ssé.
en: At that time,   some people came and reported to him about the Galileans  # 13:1 Jn 4:45 whose blood Pilate  # 13:1 Mt 27:2 had mixed with their sacrifices.

ngiemboon: Á zẅíʼte tà á kuʼ, á tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pi lɔgɔ ńkwaŋa ngie pʉ̀a Ngalílîa apɛ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńkwé púʼu, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ megàŋ mefʉa ńcʉa petsɔ́ keen?
en: And he   responded to them, “Do you think that these Galileans were more sinful than all the other Galileans because they suffered these things?   # 13:2 Jn 9:2

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, á té púʼu wɔ́, pi zsé ngie pi lɔɔn ńké te kúbe gẅi mà wɔ́, mbà pi ge gÿo lége gí pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́b.
en: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all perish as well.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńkímte pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né legém pie máa ndá la keme ńzẅéte wɔ́b á Siloe. Pi kwǎŋ ngie pɛ̌ pʉ̀a lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ ńcʉa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm metsèm lá?
en: Or those eighteen that the tower in Siloam    fell on and killed #— #do you think they were more sinful than all the other people who live in Jerusalem?

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, á té púʼu wɔ́, pi zsé ngie pi lɔɔn ńké te kúbe gẅi mà wɔ́, mbà pi ge gÿo lége gí pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́b.»
en: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all perish as well.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn yɔɔn sagánò ngie: «Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ la pye tÿǒ pÿɛ̀ tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ mé, ńgÿo ńnéŋe tà ńtóo lékáb ntɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ, à te mmó gyá,
en: And he told this parable:   “A man had a fig tree that was planted in his vineyard. He came looking for fruit on it and found none.   # 13:6 Mt 21:18–19; Mk 11:13

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwó ngàŋafàʼ ngie: “Ée fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ tá páʼ n ne ńtóo faʼa ntɔ̌ɔn na tÿǒ pÿɛ̀ yɔɔn, n těen ńgyá wɔ́. Kɔ́ʼɔ ḿmaʼa ssé! Ńtí kɔ́ á jÿó jʉʼʉ tsetsáʼ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ?”
en: He told the vineyard worker, ‘Listen, for three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree and haven’t found any. Cut it down!    Why should it even waste the soil? ’   # 13:7 Is 5:2

ngiemboon: Ngàŋafàʼ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: “Andè, mé náʼa ńnyé yé yɔɔn ngùʼ, n ge taʼte letsiŋé sé, é lɔg kʉ̀ŋe tsáb,
en: “But he replied to him, ‘Sir,    leave it this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.   # 13:8 Lk 16:3

ngiemboon: púʼu, kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á láʼa fʉ̀ʼ páʼɔɔn ńzém ntɔ̌ɔn wɔ́ɔ? Ńké ḿbiŋ te zém, ɔ̀ tsẅi n kɔ́ʼ.”»
en: Perhaps it will produce fruit next year, but if not, you can cut it down.’ ”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà, Yěsô gwɔ́ ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà ńne ńdaʼte nò Ssé mbwó láʼ.
en: As he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath,

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ yé wó, mbà é gÿǒ ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né legém páʼ tsɔ̌ ssé tepòŋ la gwoon yé ḿbwɔ́ʼ nkàʼ wé, tà tsɔ̌ légíŋ ḿbʉʼʉ nnɛ́ ńtyé tyé, à te wó wɔ́.
en: a woman was there who had been disabled by a spirit  ,# 13:11 Mt 8:17; Lk 4:33; 6:18; 7:21; 8:2,29; 9:39 for over eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.  # 13:11 Or straighten up completely

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá yé, ńtóŋo yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Mɔ̌ɔn, aguɔ jú yɛ̂ mǎg,»
en: When Jesus saw her, he called out to her,   “Woman, you are free of your disability.”

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńzáb mbwó mé twó manzwě ŋwɛ́. Á gwóon ḿbʉʼʉ nnɛ́ ńtyé ndʉŋndʉŋ, ńzye leguʼte Ssé.
en: Then he laid his hands on her,   and instantly she was restored  # 13:13 Ac 15:16; Heb 12:12 and began to glorify God.  # 13:13 Jn 11:4

ngiemboon: Táʼ, nyìŋ gẅie à tyé twómvfò tsɛ̀ɛ ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà gyá púʼu, anò gyáŋa yé, mélàʼmie Yěsô gÿǒ nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛʼɛ́ nzse. Á gɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: «Melyɛʼɛ́ fàʼ ée páʼa ńgwɔ́ ntɔgɔ́, pi néŋe ńdɔgɔ meguɔ mí ńtóo na mɛ̌ melyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, mé zoŋo gẅí, tà pi tó lyɛʼɛ́ nzse!»
en: But the leader of the synagogue, indignant   because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, responded by telling the crowd, “There are six days when work should be done;  # 13:14 Ex 20:9; Ezk 46:1 therefore come on those days and be healed and not on the Sabbath day.”

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Pi ee ngàŋ mepàb, awɔ̌ na pi te gʉa lyɛʼɛ́ nzse yégè, ńkyɛ́ʼ fòŋ ye, kà pɔ́ nzikáasè ye wɔ́ɔ, ńdɔg ńgʉa á nú ntse wɔ́ɔ?
en: But the Lord answered him and said, “Hypocrites!    Doesn’t each one of you untie his ox   # 13:15 Lk 14:5,19; 1Co 9:9 or donkey from the feeding trough   # 13:15 Lk 2:7,12,16 on the Sabbath and lead it to water?   # 13:15 Mt 12:11; Lk 14:5

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na manzwě wɔɔn gẅie aa na ngẅɛ̀ Ábalaham, mbà Sátà la leen ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, tà ée fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né legém, n kɔʼɔ́ le kyɛ́ʼ nkÿo na yé lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn wɔ́, mélàʼmie yɔɔn áa lyɛʼɛ́ nzse lá!»
en: Satan    has bound   # 13:16 Mk 5:3; 15:1; 2Tm 2:9 this woman, a daughter of Abraham,   # 13:16 Gn 16:15; Jn 8:37; Heb 2:16 for eighteen years #— #shouldn’t she be untied from this bondage   # 13:16 Or isn’t it necessary that she be untied from this bondage on the Sabbath day? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn púʼu, eshʉ́ ne ńkúu palʉʼʉ nò yé, táʼ, lelÿò pʉ̀a jʉʼó ne ńkága kǎg na mɔɔn menò mbòŋo ntsèm mie Yěsô ne ńgÿo.
en: When he had said these things, all his adversaries   were humiliated,  # 13:17 Ps 132:18; Is 45:16 LXX; 1Pt 3:16 but the whole crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things he was doing.  # 13:17 Is 12:5

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn ngie: «lefùɔ Ssé ée péʼe ńgwɔ́ lêkɔ́, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n dɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀ʼ?»
en: He said, therefore, “What is the kingdom of God like,    and what can I compare it to?

ngiemboon: É leen ńgwɔ́ páʼ tsɔ̌ ntí lesɔ̀ɔn sésɔg sie nyìŋ la pí ḿmaʼa nkáʼ yé, é gÿo sáʼ, ńgúʼ, tà ńcʉ́ʼʉ tÿǒ, ńtɔ́g mbwó, meshʉ̌ŋ tó ḿbáʼ menkʉ̀a mɔ́b tsoló.
en: It’s like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds of the sky nested in its branches.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «N gíŋ ńdɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀ʼ na lefùɔ Ssé?
en: Again he said, “What can I compare the kingdom of God    to?

ngiemboon: É gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ méjʉʼʉ mvòŋ gẅie manzwě lɔg ḿvoŋo pfɔbɔ́ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ gie à kɔ̌ʼ loŋngáa sétá, ńtsab, ḿbú ḿbúʼ púʼ tà méjʉʼʉ mvòŋ ŋwɛ́ gÿo pfɔbɔ́ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ ntsab ŋwɛ́ pú ńkwɔ́ʼ.»
en: It’s like leaven   ,# 13:21 Mt 16:6,11–12; Mk 8:15; Lk 12:1; 1Co 5:6–8; Gl 5:9 that a woman took and mixed into fifty pounds   # 13:21 Lit three sata; about forty liters of flour until all of it was leavened.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô la ne ńgee Yelúzálèm, ńcʉa na metÿǒsoŋ lâ meláʼ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńgiŋe ńdaʼte nò Ssé mbwó pʉ̀a.
en: He went through one town and village after another, teaching and making his way to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ zɛ́te yé ngie: «Andè, tà áa páʼɔɔn, e Ssé láʼ ńgÿo ntáʼ pʉ̀a zɔ tsẅɛ́ keen?» Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pʉ̀a metsèm ngie:
en: “Lord,” someone asked him, “are only a few people going to be saved? ”

ngiemboon: «Pi faʼ shÿó pɔ́ létɔ́gɔ na ncwò ndá gẅie é kʉ́mte kʉmté. Pi zsé mboŋó ngie epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge láʼ faʼa lékúu wó, é piŋ ké le kuʼ.
en: “Make every effort to enter through the narrow door,    because I tell you, many will try to enter and won’t be able

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ ge láʼ kuʼ, ngàŋ ndá lu ssé ńjÿɔ́ʼ ncwò ndá, pi pie pi nyé pǐ la, pi zye lékwáʼte ncwò ndá, ńne sẅíŋte yé ngie: “Andè, tsɔ́ʼ ncwò ndá peg kúu ndá.” Táʼ, à gɔɔn né pi ngie: “N te ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie pi ee pɛ̌ wɔ́!”
en: once the homeowner gets up and shuts the door.    Then you will stand outside and knock on the door, saying, ‘Lord, open up for us! ’ He will answer you, ‘I don’t know you or where you’re from.’

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńzye légɔɔn né yé ngie: “Pege metsèm zɔ kɔ̌ɔn ńteme shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ, ńteme melùʼ ńnúu! Ɔ̀ lɔ̌ɔn ńgíŋe ńdaʼte nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ még.”
en: Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, à gíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó pi ngie: “N te ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie pi ee pɛ̌ wɔ́. Pi fó ncwò ndá mèŋ ńgʉate, pi ee pafʉate menò!”
en: But he will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know you or where you’re from. Get away from me,    all you evildoers! ’

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńzye lélʉa, melóŋ pi e ne ffó. À gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pi mǎʼ nÿɔ́g ńgyá Ábalaham, ńgyá Ésàg, mbɔɔ Yakwɔ̂b, mbɔɔ pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé metsèm. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ssé. Mbà mé jÿɔʼɔ́ gẅí pǐ.
en: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth    in that place,   # 13:28–29 Mt 8:11–12 when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God,   # 13:28 Mk 1:15; Lk 4:43 but yourselves thrown out.

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a fó sǎʼnèm, mbɔɔ mbyěnèm, éfó twó, mbɔɔ ntsíŋ, é tó cúʼte tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ssé, é jÿó máamáa línɔ̀ɔn.
en: They will come from east and west, from north and south, to share the banquet    in the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie etsɔ́ pà gwɔ́ mvfò fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ge láʼ cʉ́ʼ pà gwɔ́ nzèm, etsɔ́ pà gwɔ́ nzèm fʉ̀ʼɔɔn láʼ ńcʉ́ʼ pà gwɔ́ mvfò.»
en: Note this: Some who are last will be first, and some who are first will be last.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn púʼu, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a Falísáyè tó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Fó jʉʼɔɔn ńgʉa, mélàʼmie fùɔ Elônde ne faʼa lézẅé gú.»
en: At that time some Pharisees came and told him, “Go, get out of here. Herod   wants to kill you.”  # 13:31 Mt 14:5; Mk 6:19; Jn 7:19–25; Ac 5:33

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gʉa ńgɔɔn né ngàŋ legye shʉ̀shʉ̀ awɛ̌ ngie: “N ge jwoŋ messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a, é piŋ gíŋ gÿo megàŋa guɔ zeŋe á lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn pɔ́ jǔɔ. É piŋ mege fàʼ yɔ́ɔn na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá.”
en: He said to them, “Go tell that fox, ‘Look, I’m driving out demons and performing healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will complete my work.’   ,# 13:32 Heb 2:10; 5:9; 7:28

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á poŋ, n zɔɔn ńcʉ́me mánzsè lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn. Ajǔɔ n gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsè, tà mbɔɔ wetsɔ̌ jǔɔ. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie n gʉa tà ńkúu Yelúzálèm, mélàʼmie á té poŋ ngie mé zẅé ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé jʉʼʉ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ té gwɔ́ pɔ́ Yelúzálèm wɔ́.»
en: Yet it is necessary that I    travel today, tomorrow, and the next day, because it is not possible for a prophet   # 13:33 Mt 2:23; 21:11 to perish   # 13:33 Mk 8:31 outside of Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼuʼ, ḿmɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pa Yelúzálèm, pà Yelúzálèm, pi pie pi ee ńzẅé pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé zẅě, ńdɔgɔ metóon ńtémte pʉ̀a pie Ssé tumó mbwó pi ńzẅéte, ée ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́ʼɔ páʼ mèŋ faʼá lécúʼte púɔ pí, páʼ mêngáb cúʼte púɔ pé lepàb yé, pi ké ńdʉʼ lʉʼ?
en: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem,    who kills the prophets and stones   # 13:34 Heb 11:37 those who are sent to her.   # 13:34 2Ch 24:20–22; Mt 21:35; Lk 20:15 How often I wanted to gather your children   # 13:34 Ps 147:2; Is 62:1,4 together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings,   # 13:34 Dt 32:11; Ps 17:8; 36:7 but you were not willing!   # 13:34 Jn 5:40

ngiemboon: Cʉ́ʼ tà n ké shwóŋo gẅí, ndá Ssé gi ge cʉ́ʼʉ fòmo ndá, mbà Ssé gwaʼá gẅí. Pi le gíŋ ńgyá wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, tà láʼ kú lyɛ̌ʼ gie pi ge gɔɔn ngie: “E Ssé gwɔ́ lé nyìŋ gẅie à tóo na lezíŋ sé.”»
en: See, your house is abandoned to you.    I tell you, you will not see me until the time comes when   # 13:35 Other mss omit the time comes when you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord’! ”   # 13:35 Ps 118:26; Mt 21:9; Lk 19:38; Jn 12:13,# 13:35 Ps 118:26
